data.title: VS Code crash on launch Mac OSX Yosemite.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Mac OSX 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try launching VS Code
2. Window appears and a few seconds later a message that 'Window has crashed, etc.' 
3. Rinse and repeat.

Tried deleting preferences, SavedState, etc. to no avail. Also tried changing keyboard input to US English, (It was British English, as I see from past issues that this has caused crashes.) No differences.

data.title: Stop Node.js process after debugger stops if `integratedTerminal` is selected
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64
- Node.js Version: 7.10.0

Consider a suggestion: stop a Node.js process being debugged after the debugger stopped by the user (<kbd>Shift+F5</kbd>) if `"request": "launch"` and `console: "integratedTerminal"` is selected in `.vscode/launch.json`.

Repro:
1. `git clone https://github.com/Deilan/node-typescript-vscode.git` ([Web](https://github.com/Deilan/node-typescript-vscode))
2. `npm i`
3. Replace `launch.json`'s contents with the contents below.
4. Launch `Launch via nodemon` debug configuration.
5. Wait till the debugger connects to the process.
6. Stop the debugger manually (<kbd>Shift+F5</kbd> or in GUI).

Expect:
The process has stopeed.

Actual:
The process continues exection.

`.vscode/launch.json`:
```javascript
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch via nodemon",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/nodemon.cmd",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--exec", "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/ts-node", "${workspaceRoot}/src/index.ts"
            ],
            "restart": true,
            "console": "integratedTerminal"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Debugger couldn't reconnect to Node.js after restart
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64
- Node.js Version: 7.10.0

Debugger couldn't reconnect to Node.js after restart.

Repro:
1. `git clone https://github.com/Deilan/node-typescript-vscode.git` ([Web](https://github.com/Deilan/node-typescript-vscode))
2. `npm i`
3. Replace `launch.json`'s contents with the contents below.
4. Launch `Launch via nodemon` debug configuration.
5. Wait for debugger to connect.
6. Modify `./src/index.ts` in any way
7. The following errors occur:
```
Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined
Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:3285).
```

It seems that after the restart the debugger attempts to connect to invalid port.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/26825374/6a5cf9b2-4abd-11e7-94b0-f84b9aa6be4d.png)


`launch.json`:
```javascript
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch via nodemon",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/nodemon.cmd",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--exec", "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/ts-node", "${workspaceRoot}/src/index.ts"
            ],
            "restart": true,
            "console": "integratedTerminal"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: fix some typos
data.body:
I digged into the debugging code and found some typos, I fixed them.

There is actually a misspelled property, I just added a todo note, so extensions won't break.

data.title: launching from node launch-configs: find executables in ./node_modules/.bin
data.body:
Currently a locally installed npm executable like "nodemon" is not found if specified in a launch config via the "runtimeExecutable" attribute.

We should consider to automatically searching executables in "./node_modules/.bin"

data.title: Experimental Decorators error present with option set in config
data.body:
_From @cfrank on May 22, 2017 14:37_

```
Version 1.13.0-insider
Commit 3bb9b5314ef50bd8225aba0565cadc6ca19bc821
Date 2017-05-18T06:26:49.576Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
Linux
```

![Error](https://f.xor.al/SdKzk.png)

This error appears even after adding the `experimentalDecorators` flag in `.eslintrc`

```
"parserOptions": {
    "ecmaVersion": 7,
    "ecmaFeatures": {
        "experimentalObjectRestSpread": true,
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "jsx": true
    },
    "sourceType": "module"
},
```

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-eslint#244_

data.title: Add J-link Live debugger
data.body:
- OS Version:   Windows 7

There is no way to debug embedded software in VS Code.
Add support for J-link debugging. this makes live debugging for embedded sector possible.
j-link is the standard for ARM, AVR and other Micro controllers.

data.title: Feature: Expand button in search

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi all,

Currently when I search for a string and there are lots of results in lots of files, files with less than 10 results are automatically expanded. There is also a button "Collapse" that collapses all the files, but I can't seem to find a button to do the exact opposite - to expand all the files in search results. Could we get an "Expand" button please? It wouldn't even take up extra space - it could be shown instead of "Collapse" button when all files in search results are collapsed, and vice versa.

Thanks in advance, I use VSCode daily at work for half a year now and I'm really enjoying it!!

data.title: Ubuntu bash not working from scripts\code.bat

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Master
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. git clean -xfd node_modules
2. git clean -xfd extensions
3. git clean -xfd .build
4. scripts\npm install
5. npm run watch
6. new console: scripts\code.bat
7. configure to use Ubuntu bash
```json
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\Sysnative\\bash.exe"
``` 
8. Try to open a terminal

Observe: the terminal stay blank

Looking at the process explorer I can see the following process sticking around without any winpty subprocess:

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/26817899/c018c91e-4a98-11e7-9444-5bc357fdcd11.png)

data.title: macOSX: `Toggle Terminal` command will be unbound after changing system input source

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a project with vscode, and then make it full screen, use shortcut to toggle up a terminal, run webpack, and then toggle it down.
2. change your window to other place, such as a chrome
3. recycle step 1 and step 2. After a moment, if your terminal is toggled down before you change the window, you can never toggle it up again. And if you wanna make it ok you have to **close the vscode** or **open the `Preferences>Keyboard Shortcuts`,modify the `Create New Integrated Terminal` and `Toggle Integrated Terminal` without change**

it's really annoying when developing, so please fix this bug :)

data.title: Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run visual studio code on Windows 10 as non-admin user (works fine as admin user)
2. Click on "reload" button results in same error again
3. Rebooting/re-install doesn't help
4. Installing previous version 1.11.2 results in same error

Nodejs v6.10.3, npm 5.0.3, git version 2.13.0

No extensions are installed. Running code with --disable-extensions makes no difference.

No exceptions noted in --verbose mode:

```
[main 9:02:26 PM] args: { _: [],
  help: false,
  h: false,
  version: false,
  v: false,
  wait: false,
  w: false,
  diff: false,
  d: false,
  goto: false,
  g: false,
  'new-window': false,
  n: false,
  'unity-launch': false,
  'reuse-window': false,
  r: false,
  performance: false,
  p: false,
  'prof-startup': false,
  verbose: true,
  logExtensionHostCommunication: false,
  'disable-extensions': false,
  disableExtensions: false,
  'list-extensions': false,
  'show-versions': false,
  nolazy: false }
[main 9:02:27 PM] IPC#vscode-machineId
[main 9:02:27 PM] IPC#vscode-workbenchLoaded
```

Setting "git.enabled": false has no impact. Folder has no git repo.

None of the solutions here work:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23976

Removing all folders in C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\extensions causes the error to go away, but this can't be the right solution?

Help->Toggle Developer Tools-> Console shows this:
```
messageService.ts:125Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover.
e.doShow @ messageService.ts:125
extensionHost.ts:324Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Code:  3221225477  Signal:  null
d.onExit @ extensionHost.ts:324
```

This also occurs on visual studio code insider.

data.title: Insiders build sends duplicate textDocument/didChange with 0 changes on 1st edit, active doc change, and save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: VS Code Insiders 1.13.0 (does not repro with non-Insiders).
- OS Version: Windows (haven't tried other OS's yet)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debug some extension that uses the vscode language-server-protocol (we use cpptools).
2. Edit some document.

Bug#1: After the normal textDocument/didChange is sent, a 2nd duplicate textDocument/didChange with 0 changes gets sent by VS Code. We added code in our extension to check for the 0 change condition, but it's possible other extensions aren't expecting this change in behavior and could crash, etc.. We're okay with the change in behavior if it's intentional/required for some reason, but it would help if the docs explained if/when the 0 change scenario is expected or not.

3. Switch documents to another document and then back to the dirty edited doc.

Bug#2: The textDocument/didChange with 0 changes gets sent again. Step 3 repeats until a save occurs.

4. Save the document.

Bug#3: The textDocument/didChange with 0 changes gets sent again.

data.title: Windows download velocity related to VSCode window size
data.body:
I can't believe this strange correlation.
I've 7Mb link and when vscode is opened fullscreen, the download velocity drops to 100k/s, from the average 700k/s. And, to spice up the story, resizing the window impacts the velocity. Larger the window area, slower the velocity.

This a screen capture for who have 2min to spend: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wuVCnpkL4bA

I tried everything to further reduce the elements in the correlation. 
The drop in download velocity is systematic, happens always, with any browser/downloader, any file, and just only vscode from all app I have.

Hope someone figures out what's going on underneath.
vscode 1.12, win10.

data.body:
